column4: this thing saying something about reloading samba keeps popping up and its annoying me, how do i stop it?
dang it it got covered up i cant see it
is there any way to silence these messages that pop-up in the middle of the command line?
is there any way to silence these messages that pop-up in the middle of the command line?
Reloading /etc/samba/smb.conf smb only  << how can i shut this up?
I see. are you running server?
if you refuse to answer the question, then no, there is no way.
is there a program running in the background?
no, i mean in the background of the running shell
do the messages show up in both?
ah ha - check your /etc/syslog.conf file at the bottom, where it's outputting to /dev/xconsole
if you don't have the data to back your claim up, it would be wise not to make the claim in the first place.
negatory, a webpage is required, otherwise it is word-of-mouth, which is opinion, not fact.
if you don't have a real reference, just admit it and move on.
